name: tethered
content:
tethered adjective
(TIED)
Add to word list
Add to word list
tied to a post or fixed to the ground with a rope or chain: a tethered goat tethered balloon rides See
tether
More examplesFewer examplesHave a sweeping view of the magnificent Angkor temples from a tethered helium balloon. Every morning I walked through a dusty olive grove past a tethered donkey to fetch the hard crusty bread.So, this balloon stayed tethered and held down by a strong group of volunteers. I reached a great plain where a grazing horse was tethered.

tethered adjective
(MOBILE PHONE)
internet & telecoms
  specialized using a mobile phone as a wireless internet connection to which you can connect other devices: an unlimited smartphone plan with a 5GB tethered option
More examplesFewer examplesA tethered iPhone offloads its 3g "unlimited" bandwidth to the tethered device.Tethered data doesn't cost the company anymore than what I use normally.The ipt3 is tethered. The updates will be made over the air or through a tethered PC client.I'm hoping there will be a way to use a tethered iPhone for the internet connection.

Add to word list
Add to word list
attached to something: tethered to sth Once the data loggers are tethered to a computer, they track data at whatever interval they're set at.
closely connected with something, and changing when it changes: tethered to sth The interest rate charged will be tethered to the prime rate.
